inn1.comm: overpitched on leg stump, nice juicy volley to begin with from Starc and Cook clumps it through backward square with relish, to raucous cheering from around the ground
good length, in the channel outside off stump, much better line and Cook shoulders arms as it shapes away
full and sliding on to the pads again, worked finer, towards long leg, Cook wants two but they decide against doing anything silly
angled across on a good length outside off stump, good carry through to the keeper as Bell leaves
back of a length and at the body, tapped short into the leg side
pitched up, around the line of off, Bell opens the face and steers into the gully
in the channel outside off, better first ball from this Mitch, Cook leaves
slightly overpitched, again a little leg side, shovelled towards backward square
fullish and shaping nicely around off stump, gets across and shows it the face in defence
full and holding its line on off stump, again Cook gets his bat down in time
lovely delivery from Johnson, angled in on a testing length and nipping away as Cook prods at it and is beaten
back of a length and wide, opens the arms and cracks a cut shot down to third man for a single to deny Mitch a maiden
on the pads, slightly full but Cook can't tuck it away this time

confusion, appeals, overthrows, chaos! Starc oversteps to concede a no-ball and Cook then has to scramble back to just beat a direct hit from point, Bell had gone charging down the pitch anyway, the ball deflects through midwicket after clipping the bails and they pick up a couple anyway
pitched up, Cook goes for a heave straight out of the farmyard, so agricultural was it, more air than distance but it clears mid-off for a couple
edged, Cook pushes with hard hands but gets enough bat on it to take it wide of second slip for a single to third man
goes back and across to defend a shortish ball outside off
full and wide, angled across Bell who steps out and elegantly laces four through the covers, super timing
short of a length, on the stumps and defended from the crease
full and wide and beats Cook driving, it swung a touch though it was probably one to be leaving at this stage, even in one-day mode
cracked off the back foot towards point, plenty of power on the shot but David Warner makes a customarily smart stop
Cook gets forward and clips firmly off his front pad through midwicket, touch too full and straight again from Johnson
pitched up a foot or so outside off, Cook chops down on it and the ball squirts through midwicket
sharp bouncer from Johnson, he's working up decent pace and this gets big on Bell, who thrusts his hands at it and does well to keep it down towards gully
pitched up outside the line of off, textbook front-foot drive from Cook but he picks mid-off

well, if anything that's a worse start - "we've had Defreitas at the Gabba, now it's Harmison," mutters Gnasher to my right - as a length ball just about lands on the cut strip and swings towards first slip
gets his radar functioning, homing in around off stump and blocked
nipping back off the surface, wide of the stumps and Bell is happy to leave
full, slightly wide and Bell skips forward lightly to loft the ball over extra cover, not perfectly timed but they get a couple into the deep
overpitched again, Bell drives uppishly but into a gap, this has more middle about it and beats the chasing fielder to the extra cover boundary
length delivery in the channel, not doing much off the straight and Bell shoulders arms
driving again and edged but it doesn't carry, the ball bouncing a few inches in front of a sprawling second slip
back of a length, outside off and flayed off the back foot, picks out point though
tighter line and blocked into the leg side
full, veering towards leg stump, glanced in front of square by Cook and the back on the boundary covers good ground to prevent a boundary
again that low, slingy action sends the ball tailing towards leg, misses with a clip this time and it rolls away off the pad
fired across on a good length, going on with the arm, Bell lets it through
pitched up around middle and off, Bell taps respectfully back down the pitch
full, drifting on to the pads, it's not swinging and another single is milked through square leg
touch short and steered through point of the back foot
pitched up around off stump, played towards mid-off coming forward
floated up outside off stump, "hit me, hit me, hit me!" screams the ball and Cook duly plays a prim and proper cover drive to the appropriate part of the ground
full and straight again, this comes off somewhere nearer the toe of the bat and rolls to mid-off
better length, around off stump, blocked back down the track
that's an excellent line from Johnson to Bell, speared across and lifting sharply, the batsman has his off stump covered but is drawn into a bit of a flirt anyway
straighter, attempts to tuck off his pads but doesn't get any bat on it

Johnson gets the boundary treatment now, full and wide of the stumps, the ball isn't doing anything threatening through the air or off the pitch and Cook confidently punches another four through the covers
gets across and tucks one through square leg
another well-directed bumper, Bell jerks his bat up in front of his face and the ball flies off the handle in the air through backward square leg
slung down around leg stump, Cook waits on it and squirrels another couple behind square on the leg side
length delivery outside off, blocked coming forward
slashes with a slightly angled bat, playing away from his body and a thick edge runs down to third man
pitched up around the line of off, punched back towards mid-off
pushed across, again probably a touch full, Cook doesn't time his drive towards the man at extra cover
length ball, angled across but offering Cook width, he scythes the bat through a meaty cut but Warner pulls off a terrific diving stop to take the ball on the bounce and save his side a boundary
line and length outside off, stands tall and taps square
woof, there's nothing too dazzling about that from the bowler's point of view, wide half-volley and Bell spanks it straight back past Watson for a howdy-do-dee four
better length, comes forward and defends around off
worked wide of mid-on, they scamper a quick one, despite the direct hit at the striker's end
sliding across the left-hander from over the wicket, opens the face and steers one to third man
full and wide of the stumps, Bell waits, crouches and angles a couple through gully, it's wide of third man and they get back for two
pitched up in the channel and driven towards mid-off
pitched up in the corridor (of absolute certainty today, it would appear), Cook drives and a thickish edge runs to third man
goes back and across and glides a single down to third man
full and straight, the bat turns in Cook's hands as he tries to push back down the wicket
good, probing line, not too full and Cook is only half forward, gets an inside edge on to his pad
maintains that diligent line around middle and off, again defended coming forward
slightly wider, on a length and blocked into the covers
touch short of a good length, defended on the back foot outside off
dug in, straighter line, this sits up and pulls comfortably for a single down towards fine leg
stays in the crease and plays towards point

he's done it, Watson makes the breakthrough, drawing Cook into a drive to be caught behind! Cook will feel he should have pinged that through the covers, it was a little wide, on a good length but they've not had any problems hitting on the up this morning - just a thin snick of bat and Cook trudges off having made another solid start but failed to go on
length ball in the corridor outside off stump, gets across to defend
angling in towards middle and off, worked off the front pad straight to midwicket
length delivery outside off, sits back and dabs one to third man
McKay lets out a grunt of effort in sending down a gun-barrel straight delivery outside off, Trott leaves it alone
touch shorter, goes across and flicks with a turn of the wrists out to deep midwicket
pitched up outside the line of off, defended
off-stump line, gets forward to block short on the off side

hit on the pad walking across his stumps, McKay lets out a lone gargle of an appeal - probably sliding down leg, though the replay shows it to have been a pretty close call, maybe tickling the top of the stump
on the stumps, goes across and turns through square leg for a couple with a closed bat face
shortens his length, Bell covers his stumps in defence
gets forward and blocks into the off side
strays towards leg stump, flicked off the pads for a single to fine leg
good length, Trott edges across and gets a leading edge towards mid-on trying to glance square
length delivery, coming in with the arm, Trott gets outside the line of off stump and there's both bat and pad involved, Marais Erasmus shaking his head at Watson's appeal
short and angled across, waits in the crease and dabs a single to third man
nudged into a gap at midwicket, Trott initially looks like coming back for a second until Bell bellows "No!"
pitched up outside off and lofted over the man brought in at short extra cover, lands between mid-off and cover but doesn't go all the way
gets forward and drives a full-length delivery through square to the man on the fence
straighter line, defended into the leg side from in front of off stump
angled across, Trott comes forward and punches a half-volley to mid-off
on a length at off stump, defended to the off side
fuller this time, punched very firmly straight and it bursts through Watson's in his follow through but mid-off is able to get around
dragged down short, Bell is coming forward then rocks back to pull through square leg
short again, Trott whip-pulls it off his hip out to deep square-leg
in the air...but short of mid-on. Bell came forward to drive and was a fraction early on the shot, the ball carried about two-thirds of the way towards the fielder
full at off stump, defended back to the bowler
touch of width outside off but Trott picks out backward point as he drives off the back foot
fuller and closer to off stump, Trott shuffles across the crease and works it to mid-on
whipped with a strong bottom from outside off to mid-on
lovely placement and timing, Trott came forward to a good length ball angled across him and places it perfectly between cover and point...basically just touched the ball
short ball outside off stump, Trott drops his hands and lets it through
short again and a little wider outside off, Trott lets it go through to Wade
full and outside off, Bell drives into the off side but without any great timing
waits for this outside off, opens the face and runs it past the very wide slip down to third man
forward on off stump, defended square into the off side
short of a length, Bell goes a long way across his crease and it flicks his thigh pad towards fine leg
slower ball on the stumps, neatly tucked off the pads through square leg with just the placement to allow him back for a second
touch of extra bounce, lifts from quite a full length and catches Bell by surprise but he's able to take the bottom hand off the bat as he defends
plenty of width, Trott stretches well forward and drives strong through the off side to the cover sweeper
shorter delivery, comes very slowly off the surface and Bell has to hold his shot for a second before placing it through the off side
placed into the off side, it beats Warner who goes one-handed for the stop and doesn't quite get down to the ball
defended off the back foot to cover
stands tall and drives this off the back foot to the cover sweeper
fuller on middle and off, Bell walks into his defensive shot which finds cover
full on the stumps, Bell steps across the crease and works it through straight midwicket
wider outside off, defended square to backward point
sensing a build-up of the pressure, Trott comes down the pitch and outside leg to try and make room through the off side but Faulker fires it wider outside off
short of a length, takes Trott high above the pads and drops by his feet
worked from well outside off through square leg...Trott's bottom hand taking over again
placed neatly through the off side from the front foot
round the wicket, full on off stump, driven straight to cover
a little shorter, Bell rocks back and cuts but picks out backward point
paddle-sweeps this from outside off through backward square leg
lovely off-side drive, placed wide of the cover sweeper but he manages to get around the boundary
very full, dug out into the off side and Voges comes across from his follow through
this one skids through outside off and goes under the bottom edge of Bell's bat as he tries to cut
full and wide outside off, Trott strides forward and drives to the sweeper who is a busy man at the moment
dragged down shot, poor delivery on a slow pitch, and Bell pulls it through midwicket...not quite out of the middle but has enough to beat deep square-leg running around the boundary
back on a full length, driven firmly to cover
the bottom hand comes off the bat as he drives a fraction early, the ball goes in the air for a while but falls well short of point
a delicate late cut to third man
tries to work this from outside off through the leg side but only gets it back to Faulkner
gently floated up outside off, patted back to Voges
tossed up very full, Bell can only dig it out to the off side
on middle and leg, pushed to midwicket
drives with an open face and it beats cover who dives over the ball
a touch shorter, worked off the back foot through the leg side
full on off, driven down the ground, and that's his fifty...he needs to build on this
opens the face and finds backward point
driven firmly just to the left of mid-off who is fairly deep
offers some width to Trott who drives strongly square of the wicket, backward point dives but can't pull off the stop
goes right across outside off and works it through midwicket
neat, punchy drive straight down the pitch...mid-off moves to his right but there's an easy single
worked to mid-on
swept from outside off through square leg
floated up on off stump, driven carefully down the ground to long-off
driven down to long-on
pat, pat, pat...this one is again pushed down the ground
full on leg stump, flicked out to deep square-leg
gets away with a low full toss which Bell flicks straight to midwicket
full at off stump, defended back to Johnson
tucked through his favourite area at midwicket from outside off
full outside off, driven out to deep cover
worked from the off stump through the leg side again...tick, tick, tick by this pair
outside off, angled across Bell who leaves alone...goes on the second bounce to Wade
dropped in short, Bell hops back and pulls firmly in front of square
full on off stump, opens the face and places it through backward point
width outside off, angled down to third man
firmly driven behind square where backward point cuts it off
punched back to the bowler, Bell started to advance but couldn't manufacture anything
beaten outside off, a cutter from Watson, grips a little off the surface and goes over the top edge as Bell tries to run to third man
angled to backward point who makes a full-length dive, but parries the ball away so it's a single anyway
some aggression from Bell as he drives a full, wide delivery over the top of backward point and he places it well enough to beat the boundary sweeper
a spanking drive from Bell but it rockets straight to cover
full and wide, going across Bell who chases it with out off drive but doesn't make contact
he's feeding Bell's off-side strokes at the moment but he again picks out backward point
a short ball that sits in the surface and Bell pulls it down to towards fine leg
played out to backward point
beaten as he tries to cut...Watson's style very much suited to this surface
goes right across his stumps and tickles it fine past the keeper off the pad
chopped down to third man
punched off the back foot through the gap at cover
very nicely done by Bell, delicate and deliberate as he uses his wrists to run this very fine down to third man who can't get around
worked from off stump into the leg side
short ball and Bell top edges his pull straight over the wicketkeeper...extra pace did for Bell, but the end result good for England
looks as though he's trying to push on now, a low full toss, slower ball, outside off and the bottom hand comes off the bat as he drives to drive...gets a single through square
placed through the off side
short again, Bell is more comfortable with this one as he pulls in front of square
good placement and good running...Trott worked this from outside off through fine leg and quickly spotted the chance for a second. It was tight, but he was well back in the end
more swift running, pushed towards mid-off and he scampers...10 from the over
full on middle and off, worked towards mid-on
worked through square leg
on leg stump, flicked in the air wide of the midwicket fielder inside the circle
pushed down the leg side
full on middle and whipped to long leg
dropped in his follow through by Marsh...quite a tough one to his right, Bell pushed early at the ball
going across his stumps again, worked wide of Wade who then chases after it but can't prevent them coming back for a second
full at off stump, pushed firmly towards mid-off
on middle and off, played to backward point
lovely cover drive by Trott as he leans into the ball, placed just to the right of the sweeper
a bouncer from Starc and it's too wide for the umpires
wide outside off, Trott's drive comes off a thick inside edge to the leg side
short ball, quite well directed, but Trott gets inside the line and pulls wide of long leg
neatly worked through midwicket off the back foot, well placed between the fielders and another well-judged couple. Brings up the hundred stand between these two on their home ground
down the leg side, another extra to the tally
back outside off and driven through the covers
taken from outside off to midwicket
a full delivery outside off is bunted towards mid-on who is too deep to stop the single
nicely timed straight down the pitch but Marsh gets his right hand to it in his follow through
quick single into the off side
back of a length, Trott works it off his hip and again the placement is good, wide of long leg, to make it a comfortable two
pushed across outside off, opens the face to find third man
full outside off, dug out through square cover and it's place to the left of the sweeper
short ball outside off, it's another brace as he pulls through square leg
there's the breakthrough for Australia...Trott chases a wide ball outside off and gets a thin edge through to Wade
short of a length, he opens the face and gets off the mark to third
close! Pushed into the off side by Bell who sets off straight away for the single and Root needs to get the dive out as the throw comes in, but it misses the stumps by quite some distance
on middle, defended to the off side
dabbed down to third man
short of a length, he gets an inside edge into his body
fuller this time, punched firmly to mid-off
he's early on his pull shot as this ball grips on the surface and it runs wide of backward point off his shoulder
opens the face to third man again...just three from that over
he stays in his comfort zone and runs this down to third man
full outside off, driven through the covers but the sweeper keeps them to a single
very wide, Bell has to really reach for this and it comes off the toe end out to deep cover
there's the invention from Root as he scoops a length ball over his shoulder and down to fine-leg...expertly played
full on middle, pushed to cover
back over the wicket now, and this is well bowled, touch of extra bounce beats Root's top edge
he's across the crease and takes this from outside off towards mid-on
flicked through the leg side, like Bell he shuffles across the crease and uses his bottom hand to help find the gap
uses his feet to come at McKay, it's a back-of-a-length delivery which he just tucks to the right of midwicket
moves to leg to give himself some room but can only place this towards backward point
short of a length, Bell turns it through square leg
slower delivery which is dragged down short, Root tries to wait for it but can still only pull the ball straight to deep square...a good Powerplay over from McKay
bringing out another of his range of strokes as he tries to reverse scoop over third man but fails to make contact
full on leg stump, squeezed to midwicket
flicked away off leg stump, nicely placed between long leg and deep square, Voges gets around to prevent the boundary but his flick to McKay is fumbled and it allows a third
full and straight, Bell gets cleaned up so he won't have a hometown hundred...Bell suggests the ball didn't bounce as he expected, but I just think he missed a straight one
outside off and left alone
comes forward on off stump and defends to cover
on off stump, played to point
again he can't find a gap as he pushes this square into the off side
back to back wickets, Root clips a delivery from off stump straight to midwicket...Australia now making some significant inroads
defended to the off side
full at off stump, played to cover again...one for a wicket maiden here
it won't quite be a maiden as he gets off the mark with a single to third man, but that was an excellent over from McKay
flicked in the air off leg stump but it's wide of midwicket and also wide of deep square
on off stump, pushed back to the bowler
very full on off stump, jabbed down towards third man and Bopara does very well to spot the chance for a second
slower ball on off stump, Bopara comes forward and pushes to the off side
pushed square into the off side...Australia content to concede singles
worked through midwicket to get off the mark
slightly full, on leg stump, clipped to midwicket
short of a length and angled across in the channel, waits and dabs one through gully
full and outside off, chops down and squeezes the ball towards cover point
again pitches the ball up in the channel, Bopara opens the face and thins a single down to third man
shortish, on leg stump, comes off pad and glove, I think, short on the leg side and they nick another
pitched up and played back to the bowler
good length ball around off stump, blocked back to the bowler
slides down the leg side, whips the ball off a length through backward square, wide of the man in the deep
goes back and across and worked through backward point for one
stays over the wicket to the right-hander, pitched outside leg stump, tries to glance and gets a single fine off the pad
full and wide and chopped into the ground on the off side

pitched up around leg stump, Faulkner appeals as the ball thumps Bopara's pad and rolls into the off side ... and Australia decide to review the not-out decision. And the replays show it landed and struck outside the line, so that's a DRS fail for Australia
pitched up in the slot outside off stump and Bopara pays out, the fruits align and he skips forward to bunt the ball over long-off, one-bounce four
pushed into the covers for one coming forward
slower bouncer, outside off stump, Morgan waits and guides one to third man
bends his back and digs this in short over the top of the stumps, Bopara drops it at his toes and they're alert to scamper a single

shuffles across and bowled round his legs! McKay suckers him, maybe took the pace off a touch, Morgan going right across and exposing middle and leg stump, tried to wristily flick the ball over backward square leg, missed and the ball hit
very full and straight, gets the bat down in time and clips through square leg to get off the mark first ball

and Buttler's gone second ball, edging on to his stumps! Good areas from Faulkner, not quite wide or full enough for the drive and Buttler played away from his body, not much footwork, the ball cannoning back into his standing leg and then on to middle stump - the gunpowder has exploded in England's face!
angled across on the full, played back towards the bowler
full and outside off, driven hard along the ground straight to mid-off
slower ball, Bresnan pushes forward and the ball loops short on the off side
tip and run towards mid-off, slightly to one side of Warner but he collects cleanly and a direct hit might have seen Bresnan struggling
slightly too leg side, flicks a length delivery off the pads to fine leg
full and in the channel outside off, driven into the off side, can't beat the infield
hangs back and glides a length delivery towards third man
full and outside off, gets a stride in a drills the ball straight to extra cover
length, dabs the ball towards point
legcutter from Mckay and this surprises Bresnan, who was through his shot and is then hit on the arm trying to flinch out of the way
line and length outside off, dabs a single behind point
full and on the pads, only needs a tickle from Bopara's bat to send it skipping away to fine leg for a welcome boundary
slower ball out the back of the hand, this spins like a chinaman past Bopara and is called wide
good length and angled across, beats Bopara's waft
waits on a length ball, maybe slower again, works it into a gap at square leg for a couple
hangs back and defends short on the leg side, Faulkner collects in his follow through
goes round the wicket, another change of pace, tapped behind square on the off side for another single
edges across the stumps and flicks a full-length ball angling in towards deep backward square
round the wicket, dug in short, the pace seems to surprise Bresnan, who jerks his bat across the line and manages to divert a top edge out towards fine leg
consecutive boundaries, this behind square on the off side as Bresnan launches into a drive and slices a full delivery wide of third man
angled in and whipped off the pads through backward square
low full toss, Bopara swats at it, gets a healthy edge and Wade does very well to get a glove on it as the ball skims past, ensuring third man can clean up
pitched up on the stumps, tapped back through mid-on for a single
full, yorker-length outside off, Bresnan can only jam his bat down on it
round the wicket, full and tailing in, worked between mid-on and midwicket for a single to the sweeper
gets the ball right up in the blockhole and Bresnan is forced to dig it out
good stuff from Faulkner, getting his yorkers in, this one squirts out into the off side
full and on the pads, flicked wristily in the air in front of the man at deep midwicket for a couple
keeps the ball right up towards the crease, Bopara brings the bat down and inside-edges behind square
full and pitching around leg stump, clears the front leg and drives to long-on
full and angled in from round the wicket, squeezed out behind square on the leg side, they get back for two
Bresnan frees the arms and bunts a fullish ball past the diving fielder at midwicket, he's not far off making a stupendous catch but they get a couple more
backing away outside leg stump, opens the shoulders and drives one into the covers
bosh, this one goes all the way, England's first six of the innings! A low full toss from Starc, Bopara clips it unfussily over deep midwicket, not much follow through but it flies low into the crowd
dabs this into a gap through square leg and they run hard to get back for a second
full bunger, Bopara can't get under this one and Starc ends his allocation with a dot
goes for the yorker wide of the stumps, Bresnan manages to work it away for a single through cover

slices this high, high into the off side, Bopara done by the slower ball as he tried to cart it back down the ground, it swirled above Bailey in the covers, he didn't get under it and then failed to get a finger on the attempted catch too!
fired across and Bopara swings hard, gets a toe end past Wade
sprayed very wide this time, as Bresnan stepped away - this one's called
dug in short, the batsman swings across the line and misses, hits the body and runs away behind square - these two have put on fifty in quick time

makes a calculated step across his stumps, Johnson pitches it up outside off and this is right under Bopara's nose, he middles it, smacked low straight back down the ground and it beats the diving long-off for another boundary
length ball, swung hard through midwicket but he picks out the the man in the deep and it's just a single to end a handy little cameo from Bopara and the innings with England 269 for 6

inn2.comm: full of length just outside off stump, left alone
a little further outside off and left again
much tighter to off stump and well left, decent judgement of the off stump
similar area, Warner leaves alone once again, reins himself in again
plays at this and forces away in front of point from a foot outside off, a strong punch
fuller length and Warner comes forward just outside off and shoulders arms
full towards off stump, Watson gets down low to drive, doesn't time it and gets it up to mid-off
more of a length ball and a touch tighter to off stump, blocked in the crease back up the wicket
blocked in the crease again, runs this out from an inch or two outside off square on the off side
fuller ball, Watson comes a long way forward a foot outside off to block back to the bowler
a touch straighter and Watson able to flick past midwicket for a couple, didn't get all of it and did play somewhat across the line, taken from off stump that with the angle
another press into the leg side and beats Anderson at mid-on for a quick single, it was just to his right, taken from around off stump on a decent length again
forward just outside off and pushed to the short extra cover
fuller on middle stump, clipped out effortlessly to deep square leg, timed the pants off that
fails to adjust for the left-hander and bowls a leg stump ball on a length that is tucked down to long leg
finds deep square leg again with a well-timed flick off middle and off
full on the off stump, a hint of inswing, pushed to mid-on
catches him on the pad and runs fine of square leg for a single, full delivery on leg stump that Warner missed trying to play into the on side
just back of a length and tucked away past square leg, goodness that is well timed and beats Trott at long leg, seemed like just a nudge but he flicked it away with enough power
back of a length just outside off, punched to extra cover on the back foot
a little straight and tucked to long leg whose up in the circle and dives and saves four, very good save
tries to cut but it's a bit close to him and got a bit big on him too, finds backward point off an under-edge
much fuller, ran from middle and leg wide of short long leg who runs back and to his right to save the second
off stump line and full, Watson gets forward and outside the line to push just wide of mid-on for a quick single
off stump line on a good length, pushed forward into the covers
flicked out to deep square leg again from a straighter, fuller ball
decent length just outside off, it gets a little big on Warner again as he looks to play square on the off side, gets it to point
middle and leg now and ran out through square leg to the fielder in the deep
an inch outside off, Watson forward and plays with inner half of the bat to midwicket
forward again on the off stump and Watson calmly blocks back to the bowler
and this is again tucking Warner up, off stump line on a length just blocked back to the bowler
an inch wider but Warner plays the same stroke, runs it out to short cover point
a touch fuller, driven on the front foot but not timed, gets it to mid-off
a touch short in length and Warner stays back and tries to forces through the off side, only finds cover

fuller and driven at, edged to the keeper where Jos Buttler takes a fine catch to his left, no slip in place so that was an excellent grab diving with two hands. England have earned the wicket with their excellent start, a bit of width offered and Warner couldn't resist, flashing the hands at it without moving his feet and got a big nick that Buttler held superbly
full and straight, dug out and runs it to second slip
forward just outside off stump, pushed to point
played in the same way forward just outside off stump
length ball, Watson stays in his crease and dabs down past slip to third man where Trott dives and saves well
tries the same stroke but this tails in and Watson gets in a tangle trying to late cut and it comes off high on the bat towards cover
similar line and length, played more conventionally this time to mid-on with a straight bat
another length ball an inch or so outside off, Watson comfortable enough now to open the face and guide to third man
full ball, firm punch from just outside off stump to mid-off

driven again, comes back to Broad and he's actually claiming the catch, they're going upstairs to check, did Watson drive this into his boot? It was a good low catch from Broad, Watson was pushing forward but played it into the ground
straight and right up in the block-hole, well dug out

leading edge trying to play to leg and gets an edge to slip where Cook dives to his left and can't quite hang on, would have been a blinding catch but a moment of luck for Watson trying to flick to leg

forward press into the covers, sets off for a single and hesitates, then runs, then hesitates again and has to dive into his ground, an easy single was there but Watson nearly made a right horlicks of it
length ball wide enough of off stump, driven nicely and gets it through cover point, lovely timing, foot movement right to the ball, excellent shot
full and tails in towards middle and off, Watson goes to drive and doesn't time it but gets it wide of mid-on for a single
an foot outside off, not full enough to drive, just blocks into the covers
length ball that has Hughes defending awkwardly on the crease and it leaves him slightly and takes the shoulder of the bat through gully to third man, didn't know a great deal about that
driven through the covers, off low on the bat it seemed, doesn't race away and allows Bell and Bopara in tandem to save four
forward press just outside off into the covers
we're back and Watson pushes forward just outside off towards backward point
length ball just outside off stump, blocked back up the wicket from the crease
fuller, just outside off, dropped towards extra-cover with a loud cry of "wait owwwwnnnn"
cut through cover point, no it isn't, Morgan saves brilliantly with a flying dive and there's confusion in the running and Hughes is sent back having come half-way down
loud cry for lbw as Hughes went to flick to leg, probably pitched outside leg, he hit it too, easy decision
back and across the off stump in defence
full and tails in and Hughes nearly gets outside it but forces to mid-on
starts full on the stumps and gets flicked through square leg, it's wide of the sweeper so they get two
stays back and dabs behind square on the off side
overpitched outside off and driven past extra cover, timed supremely well, that was a fine stroke, hands right out to the ball with a good stride down the wicket
a little short now and pulled, square leg dives and saves well
full again just outside off stump, pushed at and gets it to orthodox cover right on the edge of the circle
stays back in the crease and cuts to backward point from a foot outside off
tossed up outside off, played towards short third man and there;s hesitation in deciding, eventually against, the single
goes to flick off the stumps to leg and it flicks the pad to short long leg
pushed off the stumps to midwicket on the front foot
played in the same fashion to the same fielder
shaped to try and pull but had to adjust and just block on off stump, didn't quite read the flight
a little fuller and flicked through square leg, they run hard and it's in between deep backward square and deep midwicket so they take two
length ball just outside off stump, pushed into a heavily-packed off side field
shaped to play to leg and nearly played across but ended up blocking up the wicket around off stump
played from a length around off stump into the gully

played a bit firmer into the gully and is this another tough chance to Cook? It went ever so quickly to him from a flashing blade and it carried again to his diving left-hand but again he couldn't cling on to what would have been a pearler
goes to flick to leg and it comes off the thigh pad towards square leg
just outside off, stays in the crease and opens the face down to third man
very full on off stump, pushed to short extra-cover
played forward on off stump again, fiddled into the covers
forward again, pressed into the covers once more
more flight, driven hard to short extra-cover
drops a little shorter, Hughes goes back and cuts but only to short extra cover again
takes a step down the wicket and plays out to point, a single not available
length ball a foot outside off, goes to late cut and plays and misses
gets the late cut away this time but Cook gets down quickly to his right and saves very well, very sharp in there

full ball on the stumps, huge appeal for lbw, the ball cannons to gully where Cook takes the catch, either way Watson's out and he's caught, having got a thin edge onto the front pad that looped up to Cook. The delivery tailed in a little and Watson got outside the line and overbalanced
tails in again, struck too high on the pad for an lbw call
played off the back foot towards backward point
straight through him, Bailey late in getting the bat down on a defensive stroke around off stump, got well beaten and the ball narrowly went over off stump
tossed up on off stump, clipped back to the bowler
played forward again, dropped to cover point for a quick single
a step down the wicket and defended with the pad
goes to paddle sweep and misses, struck outside the line
goes for the paddle sweep and gets it away this time, square leg has to run back to field
stays back to guide from just outside off stump to short third man
just outside off, driven at and doesn't time it to short extra cover
bumper down the leg side, a very rare poor ball
a flash to a full ball well wide of off stump, misses by a distance
back of a length around off stump, clipped through square leg
a foot and a half outside the off stump, played off the back foot to cover
tighter line and Bailey takes it high on the bat and drops it towards midwicket
goes to pull and gets it off the high on the bat out towards deep midwicket, good job he didn't catch that better in the end
tossed up outside off stump, Bailey advances and clips straight to midwicket
pushed through around the off, tapped back down the pitch
floated up, edges across, manages to paddle the ball through backward square
round the wicekt, drifts on to the pads, tickled through square leg and they run hard, Hughes beating the arm back for a second
is that a missed stumping? The ball turned and bounced sharply as Tredwell played across the line, he stumbled out of his crease but Buttler couldn't react quickly enough to grab it
tossed up around off, blocked into the off side
tight line and Bailey gets across to defend a length delivery
angling in from wide of the stumps, steered through gully for a single
leg-stump line, rising off a length and nudged through square leg
length ball, around the line of off, pushed back towards mid-on
bit of width, Bailey angles the bat and steers behind point, third man has to run round and they pick up two
pitched up in the channel outside off, driven with a full swing of the arms but straight to mid-off
round the wicket, tossed up outside off, driven through the covers to the sweeper
over the wicket, floated up and played back to the bowler
full and straight, pitching around off, worked off the pads through midwicket
round the wicket again, tapped back down the track
skips forward and tries to drive a length ball, sends it back to the bowler again
wheesh, another half-chance, Hughes trying to manufacture a lofted drive, the ball drops just short of Bell at mid-off
on the stumps, worked wide of mid-on, good firm connection but Alastair Cook leaps like a tiger on the edge of the circle to keep them to one
angling in from outside off, clipped into the off side
pushed towards the covers
full and on leg stump, Hughes is one one leg clipping flamboyantly through midwicket
slightly shorty of a length and wide of the stumps, hacked through cover point to the sweeper
pitched up on middle and leg, comes off the inside half of the back and rolls into the leg side, Bopara fields
tossed up, pushed back through mid-on and there's a comfortable one
gets forward and tickles one through the covers
full and straight, good work from Bailey, showing his stumps but adroitly paddling the ball through 45 for a couple
floated up outside off, reverses the hands but can't beat point
pushed through on the stumps, worked with a closed bat face through midwicket
round the wicket, floated up and tapped into the covers
touch short and straight, pulled in front of deep midwicket and they get back for a second
drops short again and Bailey times this one better, swivel-pulling hard and flat through square, nearly taking a chunk out of the umpire in the process
gets forward and digs out a full ball back down the ground
easy paced half-volley on middle stump and Hughes latches on to it quickly to loft towards long-on for a one-bounce four
on the stumps, worked through square
pitched up in the blockhole again, squeezed out towards long-on again
tossed up on middle, clips one through backward square
on the stumps, worked through midwicket
slightly shorter, stands up in the crease and knocks one through mid-on
full and wide of the stumps, gets forward and dribbles one through cover point
angled in, full and glanced through square leg for another single
floated up in the channel outside off, punched on the front foot but well stopped at cover
slightly back of a length, homing in over the top of the stumps, blocked towards mid-on
this is perilously close to being played on, as the ball seams - reverses? - back in a Bailey, cramps him for room and he chops into the ground and up, over the stumps
bit of width, length delivery and steered off the back foot through point
back of a length, Hughes hops into position to pull flat through square leg
Broad is interested here, the ball again coming back at Bailey, he's hit above knee - quite leg side too - and they pick up an extra as Erasmus shakes his head
a swing and a miss from Hughes, who's aiming over extra cover but is beaten outside off
reverses the hands and paddles one through the square on the off side
opens the face and slides a full ball towards backward point
tossed up and driven hard straight to the man at extra cover - another dot

skids on, Hughes plays an ugly swipe across the line and is hit in front - Dharmasena gives it! That was a horrible shot from Hughes, he was getting tied down by Root's gentle offies, he tried to pull the ball off a length and was struck in front of middle and leg; the question was whether it would clip leg but Dharmasena was happy enough and Hughes decides against reviewing
over the wicket, tossed up outside off, gets forward to steer one square
on the stumps and nudged for one to backward square leg
slightly back of a length, defended short on the leg side
angling back in off a length, worked through square leg off the pads
full and straight, again turned to leg for a single
off-stump line, on a length, played back to the bowler
in the channel outside off, gets forward and pushes into the covers, a rare misfield gives them one
good length, shaping in towards middle, worked straight to the man at midwicket
leaves the crease and looks to hit down the ground, ends up lofting a single short of long-on
flat and going on with the arm, played back to the bowler from in front of the stumps
drifts down the leg side, glanced through backward square for one
pushed through, opens the face and plays wide of point, good running rotates the strike again
turned off the pads towards midwicket, where it is smartly stopped
floated up full and wide of the stumps, punched through the covers to the sweeper
good length and angling in, defended square on the off side
goes back and across steers a single through the infield towards deep cover
waits on a length ball and steers one behind square
full and tailing in, gets forward to block
pitched up in the channel outside off, Voges steps out and toes the ball towards extra cover
beaten groping forward in the corridor, just enough seam movement off the pitch to take the ball past Voges' outside edge
tossed up outside off, spinning in and Bailey misses stepping across and trying to paddle fine
gets forward and works a couple into a gap through square on the leg side, playing with the spin
tossed up high, waits and flicks behind deep square, again they come back for two
plays the reverse sweep again and times this one really well, the bat coming down in a hard arc and pinging the ball past short third man and away for four
takes the pace off a bit more, tossed up outside off, punched to long-on
floated up around off stump, nudges another single back past the bowler
full and tailing in towards off stump, defended into the floor and Anderson gets a hand on it in his follow through, the ball loops up, hits the wicket at the non-striker's end ... and breaks a stump
good length ball around off stump, blocked firmly back to the bowler
length delivery, pushed towards cover, another slightly sloppy bit of fielding gives away a single
zips this one through off the seam and beats Bailey's outside edge as he fences from the crease - good ball, that
goes across and defends in front of the stumps
off-stump line, angling back off the pitch, blocked into the covers - just one off the over
Voges follows his captain's lead, reversing the hands and swiping the ball hard past the man on the edge of the ring for another boundary to third man
floated up outside off stump, goes across and deftly flicks the ball fine on the leg side
length ball, around off stump, defended with bat and pad back to the bowler
tossed up on the stumps, tickled down the ground for a single to long-on
pitching middle and leg, worked wide of midwicket for one more
full and flighted, drifting across outside off, punched back and Tredwell fields off his own bowling
good length, around the line of off, blocked short on the off side and they amble one
touch wider, Voges opens his shoulders and hits aggressively into the covers, again they pick up a single
coming back in off a length, brings the bat down at an angle and squeezes one behind square on the leg side

Voges swings, misses and is bowled, Bresnan strikes for England! Looked like a little offcutter, rolling his fingers over the ball and it jinked back just enough off the pitch as Voges tried to hit down the ground, beat the bat on the inside and clattered into the top of middle and off stump
slightly back of a length, stays in the crease and jabs at it defensively
beaten, prodding without any foot movement at a length delivery in the channel
slightly short and outside off, Bailey guides a single down to third man
good line and length, Marsh goes back and blocks in front of off stump
slightly fuller, angled in and Marsh drives off the back foot into the ground, it's caught by short cover running across and the crowd cheers, not realising it was a bump ball
full of a good length, coming back around off stump, blocked towards point
maintains that probing length, Marsh covers the line
parsimonious stuff from Broad, targeting the stumps, Marsh can't get forward and defends into the off side
good length, zipping back in from outside off, Bailey's cramped but keeps it out
pitched up and played back on the leg side for a single
length ball around the line of off, defended
short and down the leg side - hello, Mitchell Marsh, he rocks back cobra-fast and cracks a pull shot to the deep backward square boundary
back into block mode, defending in front of the stumps
slightly full, tailing in on off stump, closes the face and clips wide of mid-on for a hasty single

back of a length and pushed off the back foot straight to point and Anderson becomes the highest wicket-taker in one-day cricket for England. A loose stroke from Marsh outside off, it went at a good catchable height, very quickly but straight to Morgan who clung on at chest height with two hands, a sharp grab
full ball the swings slightly into the pads, Wade gets a back down onto it and turns it down to long leg
full of length just outside off, dabbed to point coming forward, just in front of the fielder so they take a quick single
this slides away from Wade who get a little squared up defending on off stump towards cover
blocked just outside off stump now, again into the covers from the crease

full and sliding past the outside edge, taken by the keeper and given out! Umpire Dharmasena nodded his head for the edge, they're going to check whether it carried to Buttler. There was no hesitation from Buttler who threw it up straight away, Hot Spot confirms a thin edge too, there was a nervy look behind by Wade as it went past the bat, definitely out, no idea why Wade his hanging around for, he's gone
length ball on middle stump, flicked around the corner backward of square and that will bring up George Bailey's fifty, a lone hand in this chase
tighter line to off stump and blocked back up the wicket
back of a length just outside off, late cut down to third man
full length on off stump, blocked forward up on the off side
blocked around the off stump towards the on side getting a bit squared up
full length, tails in again and is worked through square leg
floated up on off stump, tucked to midwicket, lazy from 12th man Bairstow, who then throws at the stumps and no-one is backing up and that's four buzzards too
dropped into midwicket, wide enough of the fielder for a comfortable single
goes to paddle sweep from off stump, struck on the pad outside the line
around the wicket, tucked through square leg on the front foot
slider and it beats Bailey on the outside edge playing forward
full just outside off, clipped back to the bowler
full on leg stump, poor ball but gets away with it as it's clipped straight to short long leg
full ball on the stumps, tucked to midwicket
full ball on the stumps, tucked straight to midwicket again
length ball, back and across the off stump played back to the bowler
full length again, this a little wider allowing Faulkner to drive out to deep cover
squeezed out from a full length to short long leg, a shy at the stumps but they're through for the single quickly

around the wicket again, a few steps down the track, tries to take on long on but doesn't get anywhere near the proper connection and Joe Root takes the catch a very easy chance going a few yards to his left. It was a weak shot from Bailey and looped very comfortably to the fielder, Australia's last hope, if there was still hope, gone
flicked off the middle stump to square leg

flicked to midwicket and they take a quick run, there's a dive back in as the throw comes in from Morgan at midwicket, Buttler takes it very well and turns with his gloves backwards to the stumps having dived past the timbers and I think Johnson is short of his ground, the bat is over the line but in the air and I reckon the bail is out of its groove. Apparently not! Not out given, well the third umpire, Billy Bowden, wanted to be 100% sure and he obviously wasn't
pushed from off stump on the front foot back to the bowler
full length on the stumps, pushed down the ground to long-on
ran back up the wicket from a full length again
full length wide of the off stump, cracked to mid-off
full of length that swings back into the pads, brief cry for lbw but it's pitched outside leg stump, it cannons down to third man
slower ball on the stumps, Faulkner backs away and waits for it before chopping behind square on the leg side
powerfully driven off a full length on the stumps, gets it wide of long-on and they get a couple
another slower ball, this is spotted and pulled just behind square, Anderson slides and saves the boundary, fine sliding effort
full, slightly inswinging yorker, dug out down the ground to long-on
tossed up from around the wicket onto middle and leg and hammered over midwicket with a fine slog sweep, excellent stroke
goes down the ground now and strikes it well again, gets it pretty flat, long-on slides around and saves well
gives himself room but can only get a length ball back up the wicket
dragged down a little and pulled out to deep midwicket
turn away from the attempted lofted on-drive, feet went nowhere and he missed it by a long strecth
steps back and cuts hard, Bell half-saves at cover but they get a single
around the wicket, slower ball on the stumps, swung at, miles too soon with the stroke, gets an inside edge past the stumps
full on the stumps, slugged down to long-on
slower ball on the stumps again, half-pulled through midwicket for a single into the deep

full toss comes off high on the bat and loops to point. Oh dear Mitchell, a waist-high full toss, he's tried to slug it over the off side but is too late on the stroke and chipped up an easy catch to Morgan, they umpires had a quick check for the height of the delivery but concurred that it was fine

full ball on the stumps, pushed back to the bower who takes the catch, surely a bump ball and they're going to check again! How many reviews have we seen today? I though Bopara was appealing as a joke but Erasmus has decided to go upstairs. He's smashed it into the floor!
another slower ball, waited for and cut hard backward of point, well played that and gets it down to third man rope
full ball pushed back to the bowler but Tredwell lets it get away from him
back in the crease, clipped through square leg
full ball on the stumps, Tredwell gets down to it and it cannons into the stumps
forced away from middle and off wide of mid-on with a bit of a slog
back and pushed from off stump to extra cover
forward and pushed past extra cover this time and gets a single down to long-off
full and swinging into the pads, runs into midwicket
full and on leg stump, clipped down very fine on the leg side
full ball, clipped to midwicket, whose right on the edge of the circle
length ball, pushed at outside off, a genuine edge but short of Buttler who takes it going to his left

full and straight and Starc misses trying to drive down the ground middle stump out of the ground, comprehensively cleaned up, representative of this innings perhaps? Little bit of inswing from Anderson and Starc also beaten by the pace, his feet went nowhere and he was castled
full and this shapes slightly away from a press forward that gets a thick outside edge to Cook's right at slip, it didn't carry to him but it saved at least a run
full just outside off, a forward press to extra cover
a little straighter and a touch shorter, played from the crease to midwicket
similar delivery but McKay gets inside the line a bit more and tucks down to long leg
very full on off stump, driven back towards the bowler, Broad gets a foot in the way but the ball runs behind the stumps and they get a single
good bumper, McKay gets under it well
full on off stump, pushed gently wide of mid-off for a comfortable single
full just outside off, played forward and pushed to extra cover who dives to his right and saves the single
played off the back foot down to long-on from just outside off stump
length ball on the stumps, kept out with bat and pad, it drops into the on side and they take a quick run
full ball on off stump, pushed down the ground, the bowler fields
going for the inswinging yorker is Anderson, kept out towards extra-cover by McKay
a touch straighter, take a good chunk of the boot and runs to Buttler's left where he runs across to field
full on the stumps, flicked to short long leg where
just back of a length outside off, pushed at on the back foot and missed
off stump delivery, blocked up the wicket back to Bresnan
a foot and a half outside off, guided down to third man
back of a length just outside off, punched to extra cover
a little straighter, gets inside the line and tucks down to long leg
a foot outside off stump, Faulkner steps outside leg stump and chops down to third man, and, aha, the 200 comes up
full on the stumps, punched hard down to long-on
too straight and clipped past the short long leg, a very rare loose delivery
length ball on the stumps, Faulkner steps away and cracks a ball hard to point, Morgan fumbles so they get a run
blocked with the pad on the stumps, it drops at his feet and gets called through for a quick single
full on the stumps, calmly flicked down to long-on
looked very high was it a beamer? It was, an edged down very fine past the keeper too
steps to leg and slaps it past extra-cover, lovely stroke and Faulkner goes to 50, at least he's had a good day
gets down low to paddle sweep but misses and it goes over leg stump to the keeper
blocked on the stumps into the covers, finds a gap
a touch straight and clipped down to long leg
slower ball on the stumps, waited for and slugged down to long-on
finishes with a bumper and that's that
